page.title: 19TRANSPORT SCRAPTOFT THURNBY
page.content: In our area there are three main roads.Scraptoft Lane was probably built in the Bronze Age along an ancient ridgeway leading from Stamford to Leicester.Now it leads into Covert Lane once the old toll road,but now a quiet country lane.Uppingham Road (A47) is now the major route and joins the Great North Road near Peterborough.Station Road connects the two.All these roads are busy. We did a traffic census on the A47 and I made a graph showing how many vehicles used the road.In one hour 249 cars,45 vans,48 lorries,6 motor bikes, 4 caravans,2 buses 1 ambulance,1 bulldozer and 1 bike left town,a total of 358.On Scraptoft Lane I counted 114 cars,18 vans,9 lorries,6 buses,1 ambulance and 10 bikes making 158 in all.The A47 was nearly twice as busy.
